image.altText: A dirt road leading towards a huge red rock.

props.synopsis: Crowds gather to celebrate the anniversary of a pivotal moment in the Aboriginal land rights movements, as the prime minister speaks from Uluṟu for the first time since the failed referendum.

title.children: Albanese attends Uluṟu handback anniversary in first visit since referendum

image.altText: Uluru under yellow bluish early morning skies with sunrise streaking across surrounding national park scrub and plants

props.synopsis: When you drive towards Uluṟu and see the stark, red monolith on the horizon, or stand at its base and look up at its striking, powerful enormity, time stands still.

title.children: Uluṟu-Kata Tjuṯa handback a symbol of land rights 40 years on

image.altText: A woman with glasses speaking to the media.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general's department has taken the extraordinary step of releasing private emails between a top judge and bureaucrats, to try and address allegations of interference.

title.children: NT attorney-general's department releases private emails with top judge

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price and her husband walk into a building with serious expressions.

props.synopsis: The senator is being sued by the chief executive of Australia's Central Land Council over a media release distributed by her office to more than 1,000 journalists in July 2024.

title.children: Senator stands by press release at centre of defamation trial

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal mourners walking through a coles supermarket, while holding branches.

props.synopsis: Supermarket giant Coles is among the parties expected to take part in a coronial inquest into the death in custody of a young Aboriginal man inside its Alice Springs shop earlier this year.

title.children: Coles to appear at death in custody inquest, as family calls for answers

image.altText: Beryl sits outside in the sunlight in front of a tree, looking at the camera with an inscrutable expression.

props.synopsis: As the Northern Territory prison population continues to reach all-time highs, data reveals a majority of the NT's rehab program are being cancelled more often than they are being delivered.

title.children: NT prisons so crammed 'girls are sleeping at reception'

image.altText: Assorted Halloween- themed toys.

props.synopsis: Authorities warn parents of the dangers of Halloween-themed toys bought online, after testing reveals 80 per cent fail to meet safety and information standards.

title.children: Warning for parents as 80pc of online Halloween buys fail safety tests

image.altText: Via Sistina beats Buckaroo to win 2025 Cox Plate

props.synopsis: Via Sistina becomes the first horse since Winx to win consecutive Cox Plates, beating Buckaroo by a nose at Mooney Valley.

title.children: Via Sistina becomes first horse since Winx to win consecutive Cox Plates

image.altText: Two hands with white gloves handle gold bullion

props.synopsis: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

title.children: 'Bubbles will burst' and $4 trillion of Australian super is at risk

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs may be the exact opposite of what was intended: closer links between ASEAN countries and China, and the creation of an even bigger manufacturing hub in south-east Asia.

title.children: Unintended consequences of Trump's tariffs on display at Asian summit

image.altText: Lukhan Salakaia-Loto of Australia running with the rugby ball, with defenders around him

props.synopsis: The Wallabies begin their spring tour with a nail-biting 19-15 victory over Eddie Jones's Japan, surviving a spirited Brave Blossoms fightback in Tokyo.

title.children: Injury-hit Wallabies suffer major scare before prevailing over Japan

image.altText: Bowler running to her wicket keeper, jumping in the air, celebrating a wicket

props.synopsis: Australian and South Africa face off in their final pool match of the Women's Cricket World Cup, with the winner entering the semifinals as the number one ranked team.

title.children: Australia vs South Africa, Women's Cricket World Cup, live scores, stats

image.altText: An aircraft carrier travels down a waterway surrounded by rugged hills.

props.synopsis: It is a major escalation in a US military build-up in the Caribbean, with Venezuela's leader warning the Trump administration is "fabricating a war".

title.children: Trump sending aircraft carrier to Latin America as war fears escalate

image.altText: An WS logo and a broken ethernet cable

props.synopsis: The outage caused global turmoil among thousands of sites, including some of the web's most popular apps such as Snapchat and Reddit.

title.children: Amazon apologises for massive AWS outage and reveals cause

image.altText: Two men in black uniforms with their faces covered and guns at their hips

props.synopsis: Hamas has quickly re-established de facto control of much of Gaza since the recent ceasefire. But a spokesperson says the militant group does not want to govern Gaza into the future.

title.children: Hamas will disarm — but only if there is a Palestinian state, spokesperson says

image.altText: Clinton Walker stands on a large rock in the middle of Murujuga National Park. He looks to the sky while the sun sets behind him

props.synopsis: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

title.children: Ancient rock art in northern WA shows Tasmanian tiger, Tasmanian devil

image.altText: A stage at the Harvest Rock music festival in Adelaide's eastern parklands amid stormy weather.

props.synopsis: A burst of stormy weather causes interruptions at Adelaide's Harvest Rock music event and the OzAsia Festival, amid more downpours in other parts of the state.

title.children: Storms disrupt Adelaide's  Harvest Rock and OzAsia festivals

image.altText: Together at beach

props.synopsis: A central Queensland community gathers to mourn a mum, her son and his best friend who died in a house fire. A woman has been charged with murder and arson.

title.children: Community mourns mum, two boys, allegedly murdered in house fire

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine turn around to look at Prince Andrew

props.synopsis: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

title.children: Charles is reluctant to evict his 'Prince Andrew problem', but William would

image.altText: Race driver celebrates, posing next to his car

props.synopsis: Dual Bathurst 1000 winner Chaz Mostert has pulled off a stunning win on the tricky Gold Coast street circuit to begin the inaugural Supercars finals in style.

title.children: Mostert wins chaotic race, photographers hospitalised after crash

image.altText: A close-up shot of the word 'ambulance' on the side of a St John WA ambulance.

props.synopsis: A man in his 60s dies at a property in Western Australia's Wheatbelt.

title.children: Worker dies near grain facility in WA's Wheatbelt

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump hold up signed documents in front of flags

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump were all smiles as they inked a $3 billion critical minerals deal touted as a good deal for all. But has Australia drawn the short end of the stick?

title.children: The good, the bad and the ugly of our critical minerals deal with Trump

image.altText: Dark clouds loom over the suburb of Dromana in Victoria

props.synopsis: A predicted wetter-than-normal season has failed to materialise, and much of NSW, Queensland and the NT are sweating through their hottest October on record.

title.children: A developing La Niña set to bring relief from hottest October on record

image.altText: A smiling Jon Bon Jovi walking out of an entrance tunnel with a grandstand in the background

props.synopsis: The US rocker says getting back to form after the surgical procedure was a long, slow process.

title.children: Jon Bon Jovi compares vocal cord surgery rehab to footy injury recovery

image.altText: Image of soldier in historic uniform with words from letter in background

props.synopsis: A century-old message in a bottle from a World War I soldier to his mother has been found on a beach in Western Australia's south.

title.children: WWI soldier's message in a bottle found on WA beach

image.altText: Silhouette against white wall with navy hat and hands folded in foreground

props.synopsis: After countless reports, inquiries and investigations, a class action against Defence is reigniting calls for cultural reform and accountability within the Australian Defence Force.

title.children: Class action ignites pressure for cultural change in ADF

image.altText: A close-up view of a phone charging on a power bank

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia is reviewing its rules on portable power banks following a mid-air fire on one of its planes.

title.children: Virgin Australia reviewing power bank rules after fire on board

image.altText: Cynthia Hamilton of the Swans is seen with medical staff, lying in pain

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans beat the West Coast Eagles by 17 points to keep their hopes of playing in this year's AFLW finals series alive, while Fremantle and Hawthorn also pick up wins.

title.children: Key forward helped off the ground as Swans keep AFLW finals hopes alive

image.altText: A muscular man with a shaved head stands with another man, whose identity is obscured, in a gym.

props.synopsis: Tarek Zahed was arrested at a property in Dundas Valley on Friday night, NSW Police said. Warrants for his apprehension had been issued in two states.

title.children: 'Balenciaga Bikie' who survived bullet in head arrested after month-long hunt

image.altText: Eight book covers pictured on a blue background

props.synopsis: Wondering what to read? This month's best books include the latest from Jane Harper, Bri Lee and Booker Prize winner Kiran Desai.

title.children: The eight books our critics couldn't put down in October

image.altText: Headshot of a tiger

props.synopsis: Perth Zoo's beloved Sumatran tiger Jaya dies, seven years after being diagnosed with cancer and nine years after his mother also died of the disease.

title.children: Keepers 'heartbroken' after Perth Zoo's last tiger Jaya dies

image.altText: A woman wearing fascinator with purple flowers and jacket, adorned with pearls.

props.synopsis: Sirikit, who succumbed to a blood infection, is remembered as a champion of the poor.

title.children: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit dies aged 93

image.altText: Sprinter Gout Gout smiles as he stands wearing a red and white school top, surrounded by friends after a race.

props.synopsis: It needs a meet record for Gout Gout to hold off one of the toughest challenges to his soaring career in the GPS Championships in Brisbane.

title.children: Fitting end to frantic campaign for Gout Gout with new 400m schools mark

image.altText: Anthony Albanese takes a selfie with a smiling Donald Trump

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: Gifts for Trump, unpopular royals and a new BOM site

image.altText: Chloe Saliaris stands in the snow

props.synopsis: Australia excels in the gravity-defying winter sports discipline of aerial skiing, despite not having a single snow facility in the entire country.

title.children: 'Aussie grit' key to aerial skiing heights ahead of Winter Olympics
